A lot of twists and deaths. I feel like:
So I finally watched this movie again since opening night. Well\, I didn't like it then and I still don't like it now. Much has been said about all the terrible writing and plot holes and I thoroughly agree. Just a bad movie.

Now before someone starts calling me a "butthurt fanboy"\, I want to make this simple argument. Star Wars movies have a theme\, a vibe\, a look\, a story\, etc. that is very particular to the series. THink Harry Potter\, Indiana Jones\, Bond\, etc. You expect a Bond film to be a Bond film. Once you mess with the formula\, it ceases to be a true Bond film.

That is what I though about the Last Jedi. It just wasn't a Start Wars film\, and I think the director has been justifiably called out for it. 

Solo was the first Star Wars film I haven't seen on opening night and I'm feeling a bit bad about it\, but I lay the blame on TLJ. Disney needs to back off a little\, let the movies become more of an "event". Here's hoping #9 get's the mojo back.
